summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of Laura Newman, conducted on December 15, 2020. Newman describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein at age 17 in 2002, detailing how dance-inspired workouts evolved into sexual encounters, his control over her life, and her interactions with his associates. The document records her allegations of abuse and financial manipulation.

persons.name: Laura Newman
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI interview. She describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein at age 17, with dance workouts that evolved into sexual encounters, and details his control over her life and career.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described by Newman as the man she met at 17. He allegedly initiated sexual encounters, paid her for massages, controlled aspects of her life, and asked her to introduce him to friends.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned by Newman as someone she met at Epstein's house.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Present on the phone call as Laura Newman's attorney during the FBI interview.

persons.name: Nadia Marcinko
persons.context: Identified by Newman as 'the NADIA she spoke about earlier,' described as a tall blonde and Epstein's 'main NADIA.'

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: One of the individuals Newman states she met through Epstein.

persons.name: Jean-Luc
persons.context: One of the individuals Newman states she met through Epstein.

persons.name: Fredrick Packie
persons.context: One of the individuals Newman states she met through Epstein.

connections.description: Newman describes meeting Epstein at 17, with their interactions evolving from dance workouts to sexual encounters. She states he controlled aspects of her life and paid her for massages/sexual acts.
Henderson was present as Newman's attorney during the FBI interview.
Newman states she met Prince Andrew at Epstein's house, indicating a social connection.
Newman identifies Marcinko as Epstein's 'main NADIA,' suggesting a close or primary association.
Newman met Kellen through Epstein, indicating Kellen was part of his social or operational circle.

events.title: Newman's First Meeting with Epstein
events.description: Laura Newman, age 17, meets Jeffrey Epstein after being approached outside her ballet class in New York. The initial encounter is arranged for 'dance inspired work outs.'

events.title: Evolution of Abuse
events.description: Newman's sessions with Epstein, occurring 3-6 times in the first few years, morphed from workouts to massages in her underwear, and then to sexual activities including masturbation and penetration between the 2nd and 4th sessions.

events.title: Post-Release Contact
events.description: Newman states she saw Epstein around 2010 after he got out of jail, indicating contact continued after his 2008 conviction.

events.title: FBI Interview of Laura Newman
events.description: FBI agents and a detective interview Laura Newman over the phone regarding her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein. Her attorney, Brittany Henderson, is present.

locations: New York, New York, United States
Steps on Broadway (ballet studio in New York)
keyFacts: Laura Newman alleges she first met Jeffrey Epstein in 2002 when she was 17 years old, with initial 'dance inspired work outs' quickly evolving into sexual encounters.
Newman states Epstein exercised control over her life, discouraging her from going to college and making different career choices, and used her financial vulnerability to manipulate her.
Epstein paid Newman on a scale: $100 for a massage with clothes on and $300 with clothes off, with additional payments for being 'well behaved' and for auditions, clothes, and hair salons.
Newman met several of Epstein's associates, including Prince Andrew, Nadia Marcinko (described as his 'main NADIA'), Sarah Kellen, Jean-Luc, and Fredrick Packie.
The interview confirms post-conviction contact, with Newman stating she saw Epstein around 2010 after he was released from jail.
